results.title: Energy transfer devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Steam and diesel, and high speed electric trains are all studied as examples of energy transfer, concentrating on electricity generation. A plea for solar-based energy is made.

results.title: Electronics in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Through simple diagrams and explanations this film illustrates the role of valves, transistors, IC’s, oscillators, filters, amplifiers and microprocessors in basic electronics and discusses their application in computers, electrical appliances, sound recording and medical diagnosis.

group_works.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
group_works.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.
results.title_for_label: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bowen-Jones, BBC, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions and UNICEF

results.title: John Barrymore
results.creator_credit: David L. Wolper and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Portrays events in the life of film and theatre idol John Barrymore, using photographs and film footage. An excellent, insightful and refreshingly unsentimental biography. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Joseph Stalin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Depicts the life of Stalin, under whose strong-arm rule the USSR became a world power. Explains Stalin’s part in making Russia a communist state. Commentary by Mike Wallace. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Traces the life of Mussolini from his youth to the development of his own party and the Munich conference with Hitler. Shows his arrest and exile, capture and shooting. Introduced by Mussolini’s son and narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Mao Tse Tung
results.creator_credit: Alan Landsburg, David L. Wolper and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Traces Mao Tse Tung’s life from his birth in Hunan Province, 1893, to becoming leader of Communist China. In 1920 he set out to gain control of China, in 1949 he proclaimed the birth of the communist regime in China. Shows how he gained leadership, banished Chiang Kai-Shek and his armies from the mainland, fought the U.N. forces to a stalemate on the 38th parallel, and presented a challenge to the western world. Narrated by Mike Wallace.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Landsburg, David L. Wolper and McGraw-Hill Films
